Executive Summary

This Risk Management Plan (RMP) updates the City of Donna Wastewater Treatment Plant from a Prevention Program 2 to a Prevention Program 3 and includes the required elements of Process Safety Management (PSM). Operations Management International, Inc. (OMI), a private contractor, operates the plant. A wastewater treatment plant operated by a private contractor is subject to Prevention Program 3, which encompasses the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) PSM standards. The contents of this RMP and PSM document the Donna Wastewater Treatment Plant?s compliance with the Clean Air Act Section 112 (r)(7), 40 CFR 68, and 29 CFR 1910.119 for the protection of employees, the public and the environment.

The City of Donna Wastewater Treatment Plant accidental release prevention policy integrates technologies, procedures, and management practices. The Donna emergency response policy involves the preparation of a response plan tailored to each facility and to the emergency response services available in the community. The policy adheres to EPA Prevention Program procedures where applicable, OSHA PSM standards, and complies with EPA Emergency Response Program requirements.

The City of Donna Wastewater Treatment Plant is located at 1 ? Mile South Old River Road, Donna, Hidalgo County, Texas, at north 26.149167 Latitude and west -98.053889 Longitude. It serves approximately 14,800 people.

The chemical storage building is located on the southwest side of the plant.  The building is three sided and houses two one-ton cylinders of chlorine.  One cylinder is connected to the system and the other is for backup. The cylinders are equipped with manual shutoff valves in the event of an emergency, and an alarm activates at the occurrence of a release. Personnel oversee the facility eight hours a day, including daily inspections of the chemical storage building.

The City of Donna Fire and Police Departments reviewed the facility=s Emergency Response Program. Both departments are members of the Hidalgo County Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC). The program includes an emergency response decision tree and a notification plan. Donna Water Treatment Plant management and staff conduct annual reviews of emergency response drills, drill evaluations, and emergency operation and response procedures.
